head.supplied: Melbourne, 16th February 1881 ¶ The Town clerk ¶ Portland ¶ Dear Sir ¶ ¶ In continuation of my former sendings of seeds of plants suitable for binding coastsand, I have the pleasure of forwarding to ...

div.p: Letters received, book 7, no. 1217, Borough Council records, Warrnambool, Victoria.
MS written by G. Luehmann and signed by M. For a summary of this letter see Warrnambool standard, 3 March 1881, p. 2. Melbourne, 16th February 1881

In continuation of my former sendings of seeds of plants suitable for binding coastsand, I have the pleasure of forwarding to you herewith a package with seeds of the Californian shrubby Lupine,
Presumably Lupinus arboreus Sims; see B95.13.02, p. 292. which is highly esteemed for this purpose. The seeds should be soaked in water for some hours before they are sown and the young plants protected by brushwood until they are sufficiently strong to take care of themselves. I also send some seeds of the Victorian Sandstay (Leptospermum laevigatum).

p.style: font-family: Geneva, ﷽﷽﷽﷽﷽﷽; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

div.p: I have the honor to be dear Sir

div.p:
Ferd. von Mueller.
This letter was tabled at a meeting of the Warrnambool Town Council on 1 March 1881, and minuted to be 'acknowledged with thanks' (Minute book 1874-81, Municipal District records, Warrnambool, Vic). See C. Cramer to M, 8 March 1881.
